App Configuration Documentation
RTOS_CMSISOS_RTOS001 App

The diagram shows the UI for the App.


Name URI Description
RTOS Selection rtos001_erwrtosselection Selects the specific RTOS to be used.
Currently only RTX is supported.
Memory Pools rtos001_erwmempool Enables support for Memory Pools.
CMSIS RTOS supports fixed sized memory pools.
When the memory pool is initialized, the RTX kernel handles memory requests by allocating a block of memory from the memory pool.
Mail Queues rtos001_erwmailq Enables support for Mail Queues.
A mail is a memory block that is send to a thread or interrupt service routine.
Message Queues rtos001_erwmsgq Enables support for Message Queues.
A message can be a integer or pointer value that is send to a thread or ISR.
Generic Wait Function rtos001_erwoswait Enables support for the generic wait function osWait.
RTX RTOS does not support this feature.
Maximum Signal Flags rtos001_irwsignals Configures the maximum Signal Flags available per thread.
The CMSIS-RTOS API may support a variable number of signal flags.
For RTX RTOS this parameter is not configurable; fixed value of 16 Signal Flags per thread is used.
Maximum Semaphore Resources rtos001_irwsemaphores Configures the maximum index count for a Semaphore.
It should be within the range of 1 to 65535.



Name URI Description
Timer Tick value in us rtos001_irwtick This allows user to enter timer tick value in us(For SysTick Timer Configuration)
Unit : us
Range : 1 to 1000000
Maximum Number of concurrent running threads rtos001_irwtaskcnt This allows user to enter maximum number of threads that will run at the same time
Unit : number of tasks
Range : 0 to 250
Number of threads with default stack size rtos001_irdefaultcnt This is the difference between number of concurrent running threads and number of threads with user provided stack size.This is non-editable.
Unit : number of tasks
Range : 0 to 250
Number of threads with user-provided stack size rtos001_irwpricnt This allows user to enter the number of threads with user-provided stack size
Unit : number of tasks
Range : 0 to 250
Privileged Mode rtos001_erwrunpriv This allows to run all threads in privileged mode.
Default stack size for threads in bytes rtos001_irwstksize This allows user to enter default stack size for threads.
Unit : bytes
Range : 64 to 4096
Total stack size for threads with user-provided stack size in bytes rtos001_irwprivstksize This allows user to enter the combined stack size for threads with user-provided stack size.This field will be editable only when user enters non zero value for "Number of threads with user-provided stack size"
Unit : bytes
Range : 0 to 4096

Stack checking code rtos001_erwstkcheck This allows to includes the stack checking code for stack overflow
User timer Thread stack size in bytes rtos001_irwtimerstksize This allows user to enter the stack size for timer thread. This field will be editable only when user timer is enabled.
Unit : bytes
Range : 64 to 4096
Total Stack Requirement rtos001_irtotalstksize This informs total stack requirement.non-editable field
Round Robin Thread Switching rtos001_erwrndrobin This allows user to enable round robin thread switching
Round-Robin Timeout in Ticks rtos001_irwrobintout This allows user to enter how long a thread will execute before a thread switch
Unit : Ticks
Range : 1 to 1000
Maximum Number of entries in ISR FIFO Queue rtos001_irwfifosz This allows user to enter maximum number of ISR requests that can be buffered in FIFO Queue
Maximum Number of system mutexes rtos001_irwmutxes This allows to enter maximum number system mutexes that are used to protect the arm standard runtime library
Unit : number of mutexes
Range : 0 to 128
Enable user timers rtos001_erwtimers This is to enable user timers

Timer Thread Priority rtos001_erwtimerprio This allows user to enter priority for the timer thread.
Maximum Number of concurrent callbacks rtos001_irwtimercbqsize This allows user to enter maximum number of concurrent callbacks that can be queued
Unit : number of concurrent callbacks
Range : 1 to 32
User defined function for Idle demon rtos001_idledemon This allows user to enter the name of the function that is to be executed when no thread runs.
User defined function for os error rtos001_oserror This allows user to enter the name of the function that is to be executed on os error.
